p: GS-561937 (also designated as GS1) and GS-5806 have been proposed as FPI treatments for bovine and human RSV respectively; they have the same antiviral mechanism of action and differ only in the substitution of a methyl group for a Cl in the bovine version.[ 16, 17] Ibuprofen is an NSAID that is widely used and generally safe in pediatrics.[ 18â€“ 20] Although rarely used in agriculture, where long-acting parenteral agents are preferred, 10-day courses of oral ibuprofen appear reasonably well-tolerated in pre-ruminant calves, although abomasal ulcers and interstitial nephritis have been reported. [ 21]
